channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped mattress and waste piles, 17th December
item.description:
Various items of waste have been flytipped here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coplestone Passage, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council street sweepers rubbish bags left for a week, 17th December
item.description:
These bags are in two places on Roydene Road- two at the very start and the two pictured at 56. They are from the council's own street sweepers and have been here since last Friday. We have so much flytipping and littering anyway that it's very frustrating the council actually adds to it. It also attracts additional litter people leave by the bags.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roydene Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak across pavement outside hmo 19 bramblebury, 17th December
item.description:
Leak coming from HMO, will cause injuries when freezes over. Pavement constantly wet
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bramblebury Road, Plumstead

item.description:

item.title: Avenue Road side of Green bridge, 17th December
item.description:
Disgraceful! This is how the street has been left after the roadworks have been cleared. You should be ashamed of yourselves. It’s an absolute disgrace. No wonder people use it as a dumping ground, if the council doesn’t even care. The small hole is deep and actually quite dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lime or forests in pedestrian only spaces. Datchelor Place is pedestrian only, 17th December
item.description:
Stop parking on Datchelor Place. Moved broken bike to end of street.NO PARKING ON DATCHELOR PLACE PEDESTRIAN ONLY

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible abandoned car taking up two parking spaces, 17th December
item.description:
This car has been parked at the lower end of Highfield Drive for over a month. It is taking up two parking spaces in a road where parking is already at a premium due to residents parking restrictions. The car is taxed and MOT'd according to the government website, but is covered in bird droppings and dirt and the windows are at times steamed up with condensation. Not sure if it has been abandoned but in any event it should be moved to within the designated lines to allow space for other vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highfield Drive, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Theobalds Road and Holsworthy Square., 17th December
item.description:
The metal bollard on the corner of Theobaolds/Holsworthy (West-side) has been hit by a passing coach and dislodged it causing damage to the curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Gray's Inn Road, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alan Cheales Way NW5 4BU, 17th December
item.description:
The tarmac on this alleyway is all broken up and has large potholes in it. This is quite a hazard for people at night and also for people who come out of the side entrance to St Dominic’s Priory on mobility scooters who have to ride across the tarmac. Problem is in the alleyway next to St Dominic’s priory at the corner next to side entrance of church.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alan Cheales Way, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside St Dominic’s Priory NW5, 17th December
item.description:
The pavements here are all very raised and uneven. Creates a large trip hazard for people leaving the church and passers by. Quite a few pavement slabs are out of line around a couple of trees. Location is directly outside St Dominic’s church on Southampton Road NW5.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alan Cheales Way, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
